DataElement.preferredName: Sinusoidal Obstruction Syndrome Therapeutic Procedure 2 Week Prior Or Post Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Administered Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question asking if SOS Prophylaxis was administered to a patient within 2 weeks before or after stem cell infusion.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Sinusoidal Obstruction Syndrome Therapeutic Procedure 2 Week Prior Or Post Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by severe hepatic injury as a result of the blood vessels of the liver becoming inflamed and/or blocked._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_Any period of seven consecutive days._Earlier in time or order._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by severe hepatic injury as a result of the blood vessels of the liver becoming inflamed and/or blocked.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by severe hepatic injury as a result of the blood vessels of the liver becoming inflamed and/or blocked.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Integer::2 Week Prior Or Post Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:Any period of seven consecutive days.:Earlier in time or order.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Any period of seven consecutive days.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
